content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.106 - Executive Order No. 106: Directing that the Chief of Staff to the Governor order into active service the organized militia to staff armories throughout the State in order to provide temporary shelter for individuals and families without heat during the period of severe cold weather

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, by virtue of the authority vested in me
as Governor under section
6
of the Military

Law of the State, do hereby direct by Executive Order that the Chief of Staff
to the Governor order into the active service of the State, for such period, to
such extent, and in such manner as he may deem necessary, all or any part of
the organized militia to assist local county social services departments
throughout the State of New York in providing temporary shelter in New York

State armories for individuals who, during this current period of extreme cold, live in residences without adequate heat. (1)

Major General Vito J. Castellano, Chief
of Staff to the Governor, is hereby appointed commander of all personnel
ordered into the active service of the State. (2)

Units and members of the organized
militia to be designated by order of the Chief of Staff to the Governor will
immediately assemble at their local armories when ordered, and will remain
assembled pending further orders as to their disposition by the Chief of Staff
to the Governor. (3)

All
enlistments, reenlistments or voluntary extension of enlistments which expire
after January 5, 1981, and during the period for which the members are
currently ordered into the active service of the State, are hereby extended for
the duration of such duty in the active service of the State. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 5, 1981
PROCLAMATION
WHEREAS, The Governor is Commander-in-Chief of the Militia
of the State, pursuant to the Constitution of the State, as restated in section
3
of the Military

Law; and
WHEREAS, Pursuant to the provisions of section
6
of the Military

Law, the Governor as Commander-in-Chief of the Militia has the power to order
into active service of the State in the case of disaster or imminent danger
those units of the organized militia which may be needed to assist local social
services departments in providing individuals with temporary shelter in New

York State armories, from the extreme cold in the northeast; and
WHEREAS, The public interest requires such action to
provide individuals and families with temporary shelter from the cold
throughout the entire State of New York; NOW, THEREFORE, I, Hugh L. Carey, Governor of the State of

New York, pursuant to authority vested in me by subdivision 1 of section
6
of the Military

Law, have this day, by executive order, ordered Major General Vito J. Castellano, Chief of Staff to the Governor, to order into the active service of
the State, for such period, to such extent and in such manner as he may deem
necessary, all or part of the organized militia to meet this emergency. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: January 5, 1981
